Line 47: Line 47:
== Installation ==
== Installation ==
â
[[Image:Grub-knoppix.jpg|thumb|right|GRUB in non-graphical mode]]
+
[[Image:GRUB screenshot.png|thumb|right|GRUB in non-graphical mode]]
A key feature of GRUB is that it can be installed without being attached to an operating system, although it needs a copy of a Linux image for such an installation. Working as a stand alone system it is virtually a mini system in its own right and able to boot all the installed major operating systems by a method known as [[chainloading|Chain loading]].
A key feature of GRUB is that it can be installed without being attached to an operating system, although it needs a copy of a Linux image for such an installation. Working as a stand alone system it is virtually a mini system in its own right and able to boot all the installed major operating systems by a method known as [[chainloading|Chain loading]].
